channel.title: CVE Feed for gandhihitesh9 -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for gandhihitesh9 -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-5425|2024-08-02T07:59:44.538Z -- gandhihitesh9 -- post%20meta%20data%20manager
item.description: The Post Meta Data Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the pmdm_wp_change_user_meta and pmdm_wp_change_post_meta functions in versions up to, and including, 1.2.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level permissions and above, to gain elevated (e.g., administrator) privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-5426|2024-08-02T07:59:44.731Z -- gandhihitesh9 -- post%20meta%20data%20manager
item.description: The Post Meta Data Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the pmdm_wp_delete_user_meta, pmdm_wp_delete_term_meta, and pmdm_wp_ajax_delete_meta functions in versions up to, and including, 1.2.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete user, term, and post meta belonging to arbitrary users.

item.title: CVE-2024-6264|2024-07-02T14:07:14.540Z -- gandhihitesh9 -- post%20meta%20data%20manager
item.description: The Post Meta Data Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘$meta_key’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.3 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-6264|2024-07-02T11:01:36.324Z -- gandhihitesh9 -- post%20meta%20data%20manager
item.description: The Post Meta Data Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘$meta_key’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.3 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-6264|2024-08-01T21:33:05.211Z -- gandhihitesh9 -- post%20meta%20data%20manager
item.description: The Post Meta Data Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘$meta_key’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.3 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
